title: Img2Bytes via Terminal
description: Convert images to byte arrays directly from the SanjuOS terminal using command-line options.
author: SanjuOS Dev

contentBlocks.text: Prefer the command line? The **img2bytes** terminal command lets you convert images without leaving the terminal. Perfect for scripting and quick conversions.
This displays all available commands and options.

contentBlocks.title: Basic Conversion
contentBlocks.text: Convert an image from a URL with default settings (128×64, mono, hex format):

contentBlocks.title: Custom Dimensions
contentBlocks.text: Specify canvas width and height to match your display:

contentBlocks.title: Color Modes
contentBlocks.text:
Choose the color format for your display:

- `mono` — 1-bit B/W
- `grayscale` — 8-bit gray
- `rgb565` — 16-bit color
- `rgb888` — 24-bit color

contentBlocks.title: Dithering Options
contentBlocks.text: For mono mode, add dithering for better gradients:

contentBlocks.title: Dithering Algorithms
contentBlocks.text: **floydSteinberg** — Smooth gradients, most popular\n**atkinson** — Sharper, good for icons\n**bayer** — Ordered pattern, retro look

contentBlocks.code:
# Hexadecimal (default)
img2bytes convert image.png --format hex
# Output: 0xFF, 0x81, 0x81...

# Decimal
img2bytes convert image.png --format decimal
# Output: 255, 129, 129...

# Binary
img2bytes convert image.png --format binary
# Output: 0b11111111, 0b10000001...
